opening.title: The Crime Scene
opening.description: You arrive at the Department of Edible Investigations (DEI) kitchen. The fridge door is wide open. Inside: chaos.
opening.narration: Your eyes scan the shelves. Condiments. Leftover pizza. Three-week-old yogurt. But one item is missing: The Legendary Triple-Decker Turbo Sandwich—the holy grail of office snacks.

tina_scene.title: Interrogation: Tina the Intern
tina_scene.description: Tina is vibrating in place, clutching an empty energy drink can.
tina_scene.narration: TINA: 'Oh my god, oh my god! I SAW IT! The sandwich... it had LEGS! Little tiny legs! It SCREAMED "I AM FREEEEE!" and just... RAN OUT OF HERE!'

choices.text: Believe her story about the sentient sandwich
Note that she's had way too much caffeine

investigate_more_tina.title: Follow-Up Investigation
investigate_more_tina.description: After Tina's story, you have two more people to question.
investigate_more_tina.narration: Tina's story is wild, but you've learned to keep an open mind in food crime investigation. Time to gather more evidence.

hank_scene.title: Interrogation: Hank the Janitor
hank_scene.description: Hank is sweeping near the kitchen, carefully avoiding the fridge area.
hank_scene.narration: HANK: 'It wasn't me, boss. I got a condition. Sandwich intolerant. If I go near one, my stomach gets all weird. Can't eat 'em.'

choices.text: Inspect his trash can for evidence

inspect_hank_garbage.title: Trash Investigation
inspect_hank_garbage.description: You peer into Hank's trash can with your investigative gloves on.
inspect_hank_garbage.narration: You find: gum wrappers, a half-eaten apple, cleaning supplies receipts... but NO sandwich evidence. Hank watches nervously but says nothing.

investigate_more_hank.title: Final Investigation Phase
investigate_more_hank.description: You've questioned Hank. One more source remains.
investigate_more_hank.narration: Time to check out Dr. Picklesworth's 'lab.' Something doesn't add up.

lab_scene.title: Interrogation: Dr. Picklesworth's Lab
lab_scene.description: You enter a cluttered office filled with beakers, sandwich molds, and suspicious equipment.
lab_scene.narration: DR. PICKLESWORTH: 'Ah, Detective Bramble! Wonderful timing. I was just... uh... DEFINITELY NOT working on anything involving your sandwich.'
lab_scene.narration_continued: You notice a large wooden crate in the corner labeled 'DEFINITELY NOT HOLDING A LIVING SANDWICH' in frantic handwriting. Something inside moves.

choices.text: Chase the moving crate (or was that something else?)

ending_crate.title: ENDING 1: The Sandwich Conspiracy
ending_crate.narration: Inside, the Triple-Decker Turbo Sandwich sits perfectly intact... wearing tiny aviator goggles. It looks at you. It BLINKS.
ending_crate.narration_continued: DR. PICKLESWORTH: 'I... I gave it sentience, Detective. For SCIENCE. I wanted it to experience the transcendental joy of tasting itself.'
ending_crate.sandwich_says: 'You people are absolutely insane. I'm leaving.'
ending_crate.ending_description: The sandwich hops out the window and disappears into the city skyline. Dr. Picklesworth starts crying. Your boss later promotes you for 'solving' the case.
ending_crate.ending_title: The Sandwich Lives Its Best Life

ending_chase.title: ENDING 2: The Great Chase
ending_chase.description: You dash toward the crate, but it's already gone.
ending_chase.narration: You sprint down the hallway, following the sound of movement. You round the corner at full speed and dive toward the sandwich—
ending_chase.narration_continued: —and crash directly into a ROOMBA. The sandwich is taped to the top, going in circles.
ending_chase.boss_interruption: Your boss appears in the doorway: 'Benny... what are you doing tackling our office vacuum?'
ending_chase.narration_final: They take you aside and quietly suggest you 'take a vacation.' Hank quietly eats the sandwich in the break room while everyone watches the security footage of your magnificent crash.
